title: Memoirs, journal, and correspondence of Thomas Moore.
author: Moore, Thomas
snippet: Fielding gave me a letter to his housemaid in town to have liis bedroom and study ready for me, in case I go to London first. Walked home, and with much difficulty, from the extreme slipperiness of the snow ; took near twenty minutes getting up Bowden Hill, and was as tired on my arrival home as if I had walked twenty miles.
